reference.title: New Content Provider wizard
reference.shortdesc: Creates a new Android content provider.

strow.stentry: The folder into which the source code for the new content provider is to be stored. By default this is the current project's src folder.
The package that is to contain the new content provider. By default this is the current project's package.
The name to be used for the class that implements the content provider. This should be a simple, non-qualified name.

(optional) The label for the content provider. Note that if you specify a label, the New Content Provider wizard creates a string resource to hold this value. If the Default option is selected, a label is not set for this content provider (the Label field is not editable); the application's label is used instead.
The class from which the content provider inherits. For content providers, this is android.app.ContentProvider.
(optional) Permissions that should be added to the project's manifest file due to this content provider. Click Add to display a list of possible permissions from which you can select.

One or more URIs that are used to associate data with this content provider. Typically, the fully-qualified name of the content provider's class is used; this is automatically filled in for you by the wizard when the Use default authority option is selected. Add additional URIs by clicking Add.
